str2: Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A proclamation, preaching. From kerusso; a proclamation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Instruction, command, order, authority. From epitasso; an injunction or decree; by implication, authoritativeness.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
